column4: i was tring to install adobe reader the other day and it didnt work, and now every time i try to install anthing i get "E: The package adobereader-enu needs to be reinstalled, but I can't find an archive for it."
can anyone help me?
i did
benn92647
you can try sudo dpkg -r --force-reinstreq adobereader-enu
after trying Pricey's
if you can get it installed properly, then you can uninstall it cleanly.
which is what i am trying to do
have you tried the apt-get update && apt-get -f install yet?
i get the same error
then try the sudo dpkg -r --force-reinstreq adobereader-enu
unknown option reinstreq
didn't abandon you, the boss called.
how'd it go?
I just scrolled back. a sec.
still doesnt work, is there a way to manually uninstall it
sorry, I got the option wrong (shouldn't depend on memory for little used options): try again, with  sudo dpkg -r --force-remove-reinstreq adobereader-enu
be back in a couple minutes
thx it worked
hey im not askin to ask question
a shorthand for 'I have no idea, since I don't know what you're trying to do' ;)
